Ad Text:
This contract opportunity suits an experienced finance leader who enjoys operating at a strategic level and influencing senior decision-makers in a complex environment.

The role sits within a large, decentralised organisation and provides high-level financial partnering across multiple portfolios. You will lead planning, forecasting and performance analysis while supporting executives to make informed, evidence-based decisions. This assignment offers immediate impact with a clear pathway to a permanent appointment.

Key responsibilities include

Leading strategic financial planning, budgeting and forecasting across assigned portfolios
Providing advice to senior executives on financial strategy, risk and performance
Developing financial models, scenario analysis and management reporting
Embedding financial discipline, governance and accountability
Supporting major projects and organisational change initiatives
Coaching and mentoring management accounting staff
You will bring

Postgraduate qualifications in accounting or finance or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in senior finance business partnering roles
Strong knowledge of Australian Accounting Standards and public sector frameworks
Advanced capability with financial systems such as TM1, Oracle or similar
Proven ability to influence and engage senior stakeholders
Experience in Higher Education will be highly regarded
This role is offered at $90 per hour + Super on a six-month contract with a strong likelihood of permanency for the right candidate.

To discuss this opportunity confidentially, contact Sarah Purdue at sarah.purdue@bluefinresources.com.au
